meanings.definition: A strong forward movement or flow
meanings.sent1: The onrushes of water in the river were powerful and unstoppable.
meanings.sent2: The onrushes of fans towards the stage at the concert were exciting.
meanings.sent3: The onrushes of students to the cafeteria after class always caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: The onrushes of emotions during the movie made everyone tear up.
meanings.sent5: The onrushes of wind during the storm were deafening and frightening.

meanings.definition: To move forward with force or speed
meanings.sent1: The car onrushes down the highway at top speed.
meanings.sent2: The athlete onrushes towards the finish line with determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat onrushes towards the toy mouse, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The storm onrushes through the town, causing chaos and destruction.
meanings.sent5: The water onrushes over the rocks, creating a beautiful waterfall.
